intro: Gentianella neomandonii, commonly known as the New Mandon gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with five petals that are often a deep blue or violet color. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique habitat and limited distribution.
